msbt.message: Ah, ! Welcome, welcome!As you can see, it is quite cozy in here. It's funny how "cozy" doesn't always mean "comfortable," hm? Let me know if you need advice on how to spend your time on this islandor anything else!

If you need some advice about basic island materials, you should talk to Timmy. He can help you procure some of the essentials for thriving in our little paradise. And if you want to earn some Bells, he has a rather generous policy of purchasing just about anything. Not strictly advisable from a business perspective, but quite generous. Yes, yes!
Oh! One more important thingI'm offering a free DIY workshop that can help you really build out your island experience. I think it would be quite useful, so I do hope you take me up on it, hm?

Ah, !Welcome to Resident Services! This is where we support the lives of all island residents. Feel free to chat with me about island life anytime.For island business, Isabelle will be happy to assist you.

Ah, ! Welcome, welcome!This is Resident Services. Here, we provide support for all the residents of .I'm sure you've already got the hang of deserted-island life, but please stop by if you ever need help!

Now, normally the first thing we ask of any package-plan members is to attend a special DIY workshop.However, I don't think there's any need for that since you've already been to one on your previous island.

But, if you have time, it would be wonderful if I could get your help investigating the local wildlife.If you happen to catch any bugs or fish, please bring them back here to me. I would love to see them!
So why don't you get out there and enjoy deserted-island life, hm?
So why don't you get out there and enjoy life on your new island, hm?

It is good to be good! Yes, yes!I'm glad to see that you're taking the initiative to explore and learn all about our new island home. But do please feel free to ask for help when you need it. That's what we're here for, hm?
Good, good, good! Come see me anytime at all, hm?
Yes, yesthat IS the question

Ah! I've got just the thing. You have yet to attend one of my DIY workshops, hm? Once you get going with DIY, you'll really open some new doors. I daresay it's crucial to island life! And, of course, the workshop is completely free. No hidden fees! I do recommend it highly.

Well, this island is a diverse habitat for many interesting creatures, you know. Other than us! Oho Yes, yesyou can catch all kinds of insects and fish if you practice with your net and fishing rod. I'd be most curious to see any creatures that you do catch, hm? By all means, bring them to me!
I've got just the thing for you! My good friend Blathers will be joining us on . Would you be so kind as to stake out a small area for him to get set up? Say, about one tent's worth of room?
By the way, thank you so much for finding a place for Blathers to set up.Ah, but you're looking for a practical suggestion, hm?
WellI don't mean to rush you, but there is the small matter of your move-in fees Putting in some work to chip away at those is always time well spent, if you ask me!
After all, you can satisfy the loan with a mere 5,000 miles! You should be able to earn that in no time.
In the Nook Miles app, you'll find info on how folks new to deserted- island life can earn miles!Scan the app to see the initial miles goals, and then pick one you think you can work on!
Remember, you'll get a notification right on your NookPhone when you've done anything to earn miles. Do be sure to check it out—I think you'll find it quite useful, hm?

Ah, but you could probably use some suggestions about how to earn more miles, hm? Well, the program certainly rewards DIY users quite handsomely!And remember, my workbench is your workbench. You can use it anytime you like.
And did you know that you can earn miles simply by learning new DIY recipes? Yes, yes! Just talk to Timmy if you're looking to purchase some recipes.

Of course, a good way to earn a lot of miles in a hurry is to collect lots of creatures and catch lots of fish. So, go on—craft a net or fishing rod if you need one and get after them! At your convenience, naturally.

Of course, if you're looking for an easy way to rack up some miles quickly, a little weeding never hurt. Weeding makes our island prettier, earns you miles, and you can even sell the weeds when you're done. That's quite the deal!
Now, if you need some ideas about how to earn more miles, one pleasant way is to simply garden! Yes, yes! Landscaping and nurturing plants make our island beautiful, and can also earn you miles.

And if you're looking for a hint about how to earn more milesDid you know that you can get miles just for shopping? Yes, yes! Shop here or via Nook Shopping! And we're running a special right now, so you can get bonus miles for selling things. Don't miss out, hm?

Well, since you've already paid off your move-in fees, I hope you'll consider home ownership! Yes, yes! Building more permanent homes will really help put on the map. I'd be happy to share more details with you anytime, hm?

Perhaps the construction of a new home is in your future, hm?Think about it! With a new home you'll have more space, and you can redecorate the walls, and floor, and Pardon me! I don't mean to put ideas in your head, oho

Well, did you know that owning a home makes you eligible for a new level in the Nook Mileage Program? Yes, yes! It's just one of the many benefits of home ownership.You'll have to pardon my enthusiasm. It's just that the real estate business is my first love
Well, your lovely future home is already under construction, soperhaps it's time to start thinking about furnishings, hm?May I humbly suggest checking out Nook Shopping at the Nook Stop?

It occurs to me, Have you settled on a place to live? A spot for your tent? Hm?You're free to live the way you like, of course. But there are many advantages to owning a tent.There are some island services you can't use if you don't have a tent, so please do give it some thought.
Ah, this is good timing, actually. I've been meaning to talk to you about Timmy's shop. Or ratherI've been meaning to point you in Timmy's direction. He should have the details for you!
I must thank you for offering to help gather materials for the new shop. That's very generous!

Ah, but you're looking for practical advice, hm?Well, it seems you could be in the market for a new axe, and we're selling a flimsy axe right now. Of course, I can't deny that the markup is a bit steep, hm? Perhaps it would be better to make your own. Remember, you can shake trees to collect tree branches and chip stones from rocks with a shovel. With those materials in hand, you should be able to craft yourself a new axe. Yes, yes!
Ah! That reminds me I picked up a stone while out for a stroll. Perhaps you can make something of it!
Why don't you see if you can do something with them, hm? That flimsy axe is not far out of reach!
I should thank you for gathering all of those materials for the shop. You're quite resourceful! Maybe I should be asking YOU for advice on how to build up this island!
Your home is built, so right now you don't really have any pressing business to attend to! Maybe enjoy some Nook Shopping or redeem some miles? I'd like you to spend your time as you please!
It seems you don't have much pressing business to attend to right now, .I'd recommend treating yourself to a little shopping spree!

I'm in contact with some folks who are very interested in moving to this island, so I'm busy with prep work.In fact, there's so much interest that I asked our Resident Representative, , to help out.Perhaps you should speak to and see how things are going.Yes, yes! You're going to have new neighbors very soon!

Ah! Here's something. Did you know you can now redeem miles at the Nook Stop for fencing recipes? You can use fencing to surround your home, parcel off land, create a park, and more! I do hope you'll redeem your miles for some recipes and see what a bit of nice fencing can do for the island!

I can't think of any pressing business for you to attend to!Why not enjoy some Nook Shopping or redeem some miles? I'd like you to spend your time as you please!
Have you taken the time to sort through your belongings since you moved here, ?Should you need anything for your new life here, may I humbly suggest Nook Shopping from the Nook Stop?

Yes, yes! The DIY workshop!Each participant will make and keep their own tools and receive a set of DIY recipes. I think it will be quite useful for island life, hm? So, shall I put you down for the next available session?
I'd love to!
What does DIY mean?
Some other time.

Oh! Of course. DIY is short for Do It Yourself!It's a way for you to create your own goods—like furniture and tools—from scratch. Nook Inc. has never given away something of such value for free before, butit's a new world.
Of course, of course. Come see me when you're ready, hm?
Yes, yes! That's the island spirit! I happen to be free right this very moment, so let's get started.

Welcome to my DIY workshop! Oh, I suppose "workshop" is overselling it a bit, hm? When you see how simple it is to DIY, or "do it yourself," you'll understand what I mean. The basic idea is to gather materials, follow a recipe, and then craft using a workbench like this one!

So, today we'll be constructing a fishing rod using common materials that you can find anywhere, yes? For this particular recipe, we require a mere 5 tree branches. It is, admittedly, a little flimsy Now then, come see me once you've collected the materials, hm?
Ah! So you have all of the necessary tree branches. Go ahead and step up to the workbench to get started.

Oh! You want to pay your move-in fees, hm?Well, of course that would be fine, but I'd feel bad discussing that when you haven't reallymoved in yet.I'll tell you what. Set up your tent first, and then we'll have a nice little chat about those fees.

Oh! You'd like to pay your moving fees?Well, you owe . So let's talk when you've had a chance to earn a few more miles, hm? But there's no need to rush. No, no! Enjoy your island life, and save up those miles!

Thank you so much!
Indeed! That is and not a mile less.

With that, your move-in fees have been paid in full. This is a happy day for us both, hm? Yes, yes You're free and clear of debt, living on a thriving scenic island What could be better? Oh! That wasn't actually a rhetorical question. Let me be more specific. How IS that tent treating you?
It's fine, I guess.
It's great!
It could be better.

Oho! Just "fine"? But consider— doing "fine" on a formerly deserted island is actually quite good, hm? Together we're reshaping this barren wastela—I mean, pristine paradise—into a lovely community. Ah, yesbut we mustn't rest on our laurels, hm? Perhaps there is more we could do Yes, yesI suppose the time is right to discuss the possibility of building custom homes! Now, there are certain challenges to building fabulous homes in a remote location such as this. Challenges that do translate directly into costs, I'm afraid.Ah, but with zero-interest financing and an extremely lax repayment plan, anything is possible! So, If you ever find yourself interested in a new home, do come see me.

Remember, to craft the fishing rod you'll need 5 tree branches.If you don't see enough of them lying on the ground, try shaking a few trees. Even if one doesn't fall the first time, be persistent and try again. I'm sure you'll shake something loose.
For this DIY workshop, you'll need 5 tree branchesand some space to put your fishing rod! After all, you can't take your craft project home if your pockets are full!
Ah, . Found the necessary materials, hm?Well then! Let's get started on crafting that fishing rod. Yes, yes!To begin, just select a project from the workbench and get started. Go ahead—give it a try!

Yes! That was perfect.As you can see, crafting is quite simple, provided you have the correct recipes, hm? And that concludes my free DIY workshop!Oh! There's just one last thing. I have a few common DIY recipes for you. Free of charge, naturally!
I'll just need to send them to your NookPhone. Would you mind opening it up?
Splendid, thank you. The DIY app is now installed on your phone and ready for you to use anytime.
And the flimsy fishing rod you just crafted is yours to keep!It may not lastforeverbut it should serve you well for a little while at least.

Speaking of fishing, I am no master angler, but perhaps I can give you a few tips, hm? In my experience, you should aim in front of the shadow of a fish when you cast your line. Yes, yes! I would love to see anything you manage to catch. I'm quite curious about the local fauna.
I'm told that the best anglers like to switch up their favorite spots and fish at different times of the day I suppose it's to catch a larger variety of fish, hm?
